name: inveteracy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being very determined and refusing to change your opinions or feelings: Their inveteracy and cruelty to their enemies is legendary. Such inveteracy against our nation's agriculture is unreasonable. Related word
inveterate
More examplesFewer examplesWe were surprised at her inveteracy against poor Sarah.The moral inveteracy of the main character proves to be an ethical and interpretive problem for the novel. She soon made the inveteracy of her feelings abundantly clear.By the inveteracy of their hostility, they had provoked his resentment.
